intro: Rochelia disperma subsp. retorta, commonly known as the twisted rochelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, twisted leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal regions and is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
